If something changes I will absolutely return here to update.

data.title: The best wireless headphones.
data.body: I was gifted this product for my birthday and I'm incredibly happy with it. The quality of the noise and noise cancelling is top notch. They are easy to customize and the controls are simple and straightforward. The battery lasts for a long time. I've had these for 2 months and have charged them only 2 times.

data.title: Comfortable to wear, but noise cancellation could be better. Battery life is great.
data.body:
I purchased these headphones as I was going to be on flights for about 50+ hours round trip. Two of the flights were 16 hours long each and I had hoped that these headphones will provide the noise cancellation so I can sleep. After reading so many reviews, I was hopeful that they will cancel out almost all of the noise on a plane. However, I found that this was not the case. I was able to hear almost everything like crying babies and people talking loudly, it muffled the sound, but it was still loud enough for me not to be able to sleep. They did drown out most of the plane ambient sound like engine noise. When I used them with earplugs in my ears, they helped cut out most of the sound. So that’s what I did for the plane journey where there were three crying babies around me.

If I listen to music with these headphones on, then they definitely cut out more sound than when I just run the noise cancellation. I had downloaded the app and tried to adjust the settings on that for better performance, but did not notice a big change. I don’t like using earbuds like AirPods, but I find that these are barely any better than my AirPods 2. They are very comfortable though, and I prefer them over the bulky AirPods Max. The sound is also pretty decent, but my main purpose was noise cancellation and it was a bit of letdown.

The battery life is truly phenomenal and lasted my journey of 25+ hours, with just one charge. They get sweaty only after multiple hours of usage, but better than anything else I have owned, these are the only headphones I was able to wear for 6 to 7 hours straight.

I will carry them on any longer plane journey because they are better than anything else I own currently, but for this price I had hoped for even better noise cancellation.

data.title: Don’t Get AirPods Max
data.body:
I was on the Apple high when they released the AirPods Max. I bought them, used it for a year, then sold it. It was too heavy, it was too expensive, and the lighting port fiasco Apple is on should be illegal.

I truly regret not buying this. It’s lighter, has more sound controls, it’s less expensive (~$200) oh and it has USB C charging. Also the “Headphones” app has a built in equalizer; meaning you can have more bass or making things sound more chill.

Apple’s marketing team is from Capitalism Hell. They will suck you in. Make you think you really need it but it lacks at the things you aren’t able to write down when you are in the moment. The bottom line is you don’t really need all of Apple’s “magic”, “seamless” tech. There is beauty in connecting the Sony headphones to your devices.

Take it from me with less money in my pocket.

Go with this. The Noise Cancellation is on Mute. You won’t hear 💩.

Stop wasting your time and money and buy it now. Also the fact that it comes in a protected case is a no brainer. Excellent Job Sony! I can’t imagine how to make these better. If they do make a new one, I probably won’t buy another one in 5 years. I’ll probably just replace the headphone cups so they feel like new again.

I strongly recommend this to all my family and friends. 19/10 rating for me

data.title: I love these headphones!
data.body: I had high expectations for these headphones when i ordered them since people were saying they were the best. Keep in mind that i have never called somebody with these on so i can’t tell you about phone call performance. I have had these headphones for 3 or almost 3 months. they have preformed EXCELLENT, 10/10 ANC, sound quality is very great. These are terrible if you wanna use them for gaming too so don’t use them as a gaming headset. These are EXCELLENT if your only going to listen to music with these headphones on!. Overall 10/10 for music.

data.title: Best bang for the buck!
data.body:
These headphones really live up to their hype. Very lightweight and full of rich,deep sounds. The noise cancelling is as close to perfect as any headphones I have ever tried, including the Airpods Max from Apple. However, the Sony XM5s give you more control in shaping your sound and you can wear them a lot longer due to their lighter weight.
I just got them for 50% off of the original price which made even easier to purchase. Thank you Amazon.

data.title: Best handphones I ever had
data.body: I am a big fan of Sony headphones. I previously had the first generation of Sony noise cancellation headphones (Sony WH-1000XM1) and it still works great. I upgraded to this one (Sony WH-1000XM5) and it was a worthy decision. While others might negatively comment on Sony's design change (not foldable) I am perfectly fine with it. I heavily use these headphones at work for meetings and calls and in other places such as coffee shops or during travels in airplanes. I heavily recommend these headphones.

data.title: Comfort could be better but overall very happy
data.body:
The sound quality isn't great compared to wired high-end headphones. The earpads could be more comfortable since they feel sweaty after some use

However I love the convenience of wireless headphones and it is super lightweight. The controls are easy to learn. I'd recommend this

data.title: Went back to my Bose 700s
data.body:
TL;DR: The sound is decent but not mind-blowing after you get the EQ dialed in. Before dialing in the EQ, they're very average and even a little muddy; definitely not worth $400 imho. They also creak ENDLESSLY while wearing glasses (not necessarily the fault of Sony but it did happen, it did annoy me, and I did return it for that reason). They sound very compatible to Bose 700s. If you choose to buy these, absolutely wait until they're $250 or less.

About me: I am an amateur audiophile. I have 20 years experience being fussy about the sound that comes out of audio devices. It has to be at least good. I can't stand it when you're listening to something and it's muddy or obfuscated or doesn't give you the full sound because of inadequacies of the device. That being said, I don't know all the audio-related terms or specs and I am not an audio engineer.

I read a ton of reviews and watched a ton of YouTube videos (especially from This is Tech Today) about these headphones. I am a longtime Bose fan, starting with the QC 15s, then the 35s, 35iis, and now the 700s. I used the 700s for almost 2 years before I started itching to know what else was out there. I came across This is Tech Today's multiple videos showcasing the sound of industry leading headphones, and I was horrified by how flat and awful the Bose sounded. Clearly I was missing out on a LOT.

Price and feel----
I bought these Sony XM5s at full price (long story, don't recommend it). My first impression after receiving them is that they certainly didn't feel like $400 headphones. MAYBE $200, but that's a tough maybe. The material is very light and eco-plasticky. They feel like that plastic that's designed to be biodegradable (I don't know if they are; that's just what it feels like). I was prepared for that based on others' reviews, so I didn't hold that against them initially.

Comfort----
When I first put them on, they were comfortable enough. After long wear sessions with my Bose 700s, I found the band to be a little uncomfortable on the very top of my head and I was worried these would be similar with the same form factor, but they're light enough that they are comfortable for long periods.

Sound----
At first, the sound was disappointing. Like all of you, I have certain songs I use to test sound from various devices and this was not giving me the full effect of these songs. I went to the internet for some EQ recommendations specific to the XM5s and this made a HUGE difference. They sounded pretty good.

I no longer had my Bose 700s at this point (sold them to purchase these because I'm not made of money), but I used my partner's Bose QC35ii to test against. I didn't realize this until I went to test, but the Bose 35ii don't have an EQ setting in the Bose app. You get what you get. And what I got sounded VERY comparable to the EQ-adjusted XM5s. I spent a solid hour listening to the same test songs over and over with both, and while the Sonys come out just a little bit ahead, it's not a difference you're going to notice if you aren't directly comparing the two side by side. I wouldn't even miss it knowing about the difference if I had to use the QC35ii.

Sony app----
This app looks like it's from 2005. It's a little painful to use. I could learn to live with it, and it does what you need it to do, but it certainly isn't an easy or enjoyable app to use as of June 2023.

The creaking----
This is what did it for me. I wear glasses. I also wear headphones/a headset for 8 hours a day for work, and then another few hours for gaming in the evening. Without glasses, these creaked ever so slightly once in a great while. They're made of plastic so it's going to happen, and I could live with that. However, once I put on my glasses, the cushions against my frames creaked when I breathed. Or blinked. And if I turned my head, good lord the creaking. It was all I could hear, even while listening to music at inadvisably loud volumes.

The verdict----
I returned these and re-purchased the Bose 700s and I couldn't be happier.
Again, I'm no audio engineer. I'm not claiming to be. But for me and my use cases, and my personal opinion on the value for money, I'm giving my money to Bose. I get more for less.

data.title: The MX5s are not perfect but I am still happy with my purchase.
data.body:
The MX5s are not perfect but I am still happy with my purchase.
I originally owned a pair of Bose 700 so my comparison is against them.

Build
The build of the MX5 is on par with the 700s. They have a matte finish which feels nice and grippy to the touch. The buttons have a nice feed back when pushing them. Compared to the 700s the feedback is night and day. For the 700s I would often think that I was hitting the button because it had such lite feedback with a squishy feel.

The weight of the MX5 seems to be just a bit lighter than the 700s which I count as a positive because 700s relied more on the headband to carry the weight of the headphones versus clamping force against the ear cups. The MX5s have slightly lighter clamping force on the ear cups but not too little that they feel like they will fall off. They are a great balance of clamping force and weight that neither the headband nor the clamp force feel like they are carrying the full load. The lighter weight and balanced clamping force make them very nice to wear for long stretches while working. Compared to the 700s I would often start feeling fatigue on my head where the headband would sit because all the weight was supported across it.

The ear cups are also a bit wider on the MX5 but a bit shallower when compared to the 700s. I have ears that stick out a bit more so with the 700s the extra room is welcome. The shallower MX5 do fatigue my ears after a while of wearing them but this was after a full day of wearing them.

The headband adjustment is a bit sticky for my taste. It's a bit difficult to adjust the MX5s because the fulcrum point get the leverage to adjust them sits much higher along the headband compared to the 700s which I can easily adjust with one hand if needed. However, its the 700s would also lose the adjustment very easily compared to the MX5s when moving around because they rubbed against a headrest.

Noise Cancelling
I won't focus on the sound quality because I am not an audiophile. However, the noise cancelling is fantastic. I would consider them to be a step above the 700s.

Extra Settings
The app gives you a ton of settings to play around with. The main things I find to be better than the 700s is that the MX5s bluetooth is much better. I live near a rather large radio antenna so interference with wireless signals is extremely high. Walking in the other room my 700s would start breaking and stuttering teh signal before disconnecting. The antenna for the MX5s must be better because I can go a bit give or take an additional 5-10 feet. Also when using connecting to 2 sources the switching is seemless. Once sounds stops on one device the second device starts playing right away. My 700s sometimes would refuse to switch and be stuck on one source until I would restart the device or manually disconnect one source.

The app also lets you assign the noise cancellation double a triple tap actions to start a directly interact with a service like spotify. Actually only spotify. I wish the button customization would be opened up to other actions since I don't use spotify its a dead feature for me. The same button can also turn off/on noise cancelling but rather the headphones given a verbal sentence like "Noise Cancelling 5" to let me that I am in ambient sound mode. I need to learn the sound of 3 different tones. The 700s would do and I miss that feature and they would also let you customize the noise cancelling levels that you could cycle through. I'd like to be optimistic and say that sony can adjust these features later but they don't appear to be in the habit of adding features to the app. I also own a pair of the XM4s which are the in noise canceling headphones and I haven't notice anything new in the app since I got them.

data.title: Perfect for noise cancellation, problems connecting with Teams chat
data.body:
I bought this headset to replace a pair of Bose QC 35 ii I had previously used at work, as the bluetooth kept failing and the sound was starting to have issues.

I've owned the Sony headphones now since the end of Nov 2023, which feels like a decent enough time to give a well informed review of the product.

Pros: Excellent noise cancellation. The location based customization is fun, but ultimately when I'm wearing these I'm at work and pretty much just need as much noise cancelled out as possible to avoid distractions. The music quality is also nice, though my main concern for headphones was to be able to focus in a noisy office setting.

Cons: This headphone has issues working with teams video calls and zoom. I've looked through tutorials and troubleshooting to fix the settings, but I'm having to fix the settings before EACH call to make it work. I would suggest either getting a separate headset for those video calls, or consider another option for headphones. This was never an issue I experienced with the Bose.

The headphone case it came in is nice, but I had problems with the zipper immediately. It's been incredibly frustrating having to struggle with a faulty zipper just to get my headphones out so I can start my day. I've already had to undo part of the seam to reset the zipper twice, and will likely just replace the case or attach some velcro to keep the case closed. I have a hybrid work schedule, so having a semi hard case to protect the headphones matters to me.

In sum, if your main concern is noise cancellation and you have infrequent video calls, I would strongly recommend this product. Otherwise, there are likely better options on the market.

data.title: Poor build quality and ultra poor manufacturer support
data.body:
The sound quality is awesome, I cannot fault a thing. Noise cancellation is very effective. Flying with these headphones is the best experience ever. You can enjoy a movie as if watching in your living room without any noise.

I paid around $430 for these headphones 5 months ago. One day they just fell apart. One of the earpads detached from the headband during normal use. It looks it it was attached with glue and glue did not hold anymore. A picture of the damage is attached.

I contacted Sony and they refused to accept it as a quality issue. They term it as accidental damage and maintain that it is not cover under warranty. They just gave me the phone number of their contractor in Salt Lake City (I live in LA). Other than providing the phone number they could not help at all. They did not want to even listen to my argument that it was not an accidental damage but one of the joints (held with glue) just came off, so it was a manufacturing issue.

The contractor told me to ship the headphones to them at my own expense and they would charge me $90.00 just to tell me how much it would cost to repair, and then they would ship it back to me at my own expense.

I have decided to write off the loss and buy Apple Air Pods Pro. Top-notch customer service is guaranteed with Apple products, and you have Apple Stores to go to if you have an issue.

data.title: Great upgrade from previous version!
data.body:
The Sony WH-1000XM5 headphones are the latest flagship noise-canceling headphones from Sony. They feature a new design, improved noise cancellation, and better sound quality than their predecessors.

**Design**

The WH-1000XM5 have a new sleeker design than the WH-1000XM4. The earcups are slightly smaller and the headband is more comfortable. The headphones also have a new touch-sensitive panel on the right earcup for controlling music playback and volume.

**Noise cancellation**

The WH-1000XM5 have the best noise cancellation of any headphones on the market. They use eight microphones and two processors to cancel out a wider range of noise than ever before. I was able to wear the headphones on a flight and barely hear the engine noise.

**Sound quality**

The WH-1000XM5 also have excellent sound quality. They support Hi-Res Audio and have a new driver that delivers deeper bass and clearer highs. I found the sound to be very well-balanced and enjoyable.

**Other features**

The WH-1000XM5 also have a number of other features, including:

* Adaptive Sound Control: Automatically adjusts the noise cancellation and ambient sound settings based on your environment.
* Speak-to-Chat: Pauses music playback and enables ambient sound when you start speaking.
* Fast Pair: Quickly pairs the headphones with your Android devices.
* Multipoint pairing: Connects the headphones to two devices at the same time.

**Overall**

The Sony WH-1000XM5 headphones are the best noise-canceling headphones on the market. They offer excellent sound quality, adaptive noise cancellation, and a comfortable design. If you're looking for the best possible noise-canceling headphones, the WH-1000XM5 are the best choice.

**Pros:**

* Best-in-class noise cancellation
* Excellent sound quality
* Comfortable design
* Adaptive Sound Control
* Speak-to-Chat
* Fast Pair
* Multipoint pairing

**Cons:**

* Expensive
* Touch controls can be finicky
*doesn't fold in

**Recommendation:**

If you're looking for the best possible noise-canceling headphones, the Sony WH-1000XM5 are the best choice. They offer excellent sound quality, adaptive noise cancellation, and a comfortable design. However, they are expensive and the touch controls can be finicky. If you're on a budget or don't need the best possible noise cancellation, there are other good options available.

data.title: Not worth the cost
data.body:
I read the reviews from those claiming professional audio experience with considerable respect and anticipation. I enjoy high quality music components - my taste has always been heavily rooted in 70’s Rock.

As a drummer, and a serious music collector, I still enjoy the drive, spectrum, and talent that produces each part of the music - even though it is now rarely evident in today’s world of “noise”.

I used a set of Bose QC35 headphones as my means of listening to music while mowing grass on my ZTR. These worked sufficiently while also giving an impressive rendering of music fidelity - all things being considered.

After a few years I wanted to see if an upgraded setup was available - so the research, shopping, and review reading led me to buy these Sonys - despite that brand name not being one commonly associated with HQ headsets in the audiophile realm.

Honestly - “overall” - It has been a disappointing decision made thus far. I get the feeling that the ANC is where the tech was implemented, not necessarily in the fidelity, styling, or sound drive.

Other reviews adequately describe the somewhat cheap materials used. The lack of any manual buttons or controls on the set, coupled with the total lack of any printed manual is cheap IMO. Its case and packaging appear to be recycled - as a demonstration of Sony’s participation in the myth of climate change - so the tech stuff like “duo CPU and 8 mics” thing - gets a little drowned out.

The folks at Bose use to piss everyone off in refusing to publish specs. They would reply “just give our speakers a listen”. And to a large extent - I think that applies here.

These headphones do have a very good frequency spectrum , SNR, and although I have not thoroughly tested it yet - I’d bet the ANC works very well.

The minimalist will love the flat black (or silver) shaved exterior. The one little paper included in the box (besides ads and the warranty) is a safety sheet that only lists ALL the MANY THINGS you should NOT do with them. Nothing is written inside to say how they can be used or enjoyed.

You must download the “CONNECT” app, create an account, and use the phone app to set up and control the headphones. NOTHING is possible without doing that. (One more tether to tie you to your phone).
Of course you read the terms and agreement when you open your account too - (and they wouldn’t dare use any of your PI, nor would your privacy ever be invaded).

So I listened to the sound - and it is as good - perhaps a tiny bit better - than my Bose.

But at a much higher cost - AND not until signing up & using the app to adjust the Sound. They are very lifeless without setting up the equalizer AND pushing the volume to FULL. This is a must.

I’m not sure they even have the volume output of the Bose. That is a major concern to me due to my particular use - AND that I do like music to be fairly loud (and clear).

Lastly, iPhone users - if you don’t play the game of getting the latest iOs revisions, certain functionality may not be provided. So iPhone users be sure to check on that.

With such a price tag - and so many ties to endure - to gain and maintain full functionality with these, it may keep “fence sitters” like myself from returning them (after going through so much just to test them out).

“Others” - who seem so thrilled - throwing 5 star reviews on everything they try, (and probably listening to compressed MP3 formats) will give Sony the goAhead on these. But I am not so thrilled. I like quality to be in all aspects of the equipment. And I like the USER to be in full control.
There may be more to what Sony is getting here - than their customers.

data.title: Love these headphones
data.body: I had these headphones for a few months and they are the best. I love how sleek design and lighweight. The sound quality is amazing as well.

data.title: Great headphones let down by poor touchpad
data.body: Sound quality and noise cancelling are exceptional. Only problem is the touch pad starts registering ghost inputs, and has to be disabled. I have had this happen on 2 different units. It worked great before it went wrong. It's still usable with external controls but a real bummer to lose headset controls.

data.title: Great product.
data.body:
Amazing noise canceling. I like the options it gives you to bounce between ANC and ambient without hitting the small button. (Just cup both ear pieces)
Only wish they were louder. Tried all different equalizers and add ons... but for the general usage great product and battery lasts a long time.

data.title: Best Overall Headphones
data.body: Amazing headphones for the gym and at home. Don’t skip, noise cancellation is incredible, and they’re beyond comfortable. Was debating between these and AirPods Max but I’m incredibly I went with these. The option on the right side to swipe to change music, tap to pause is revolutionary. Don’t hesitate!

data.title: Comparison to Bose NC700
data.body:
I have used Bose NC700 for the past year, but saw these on sale for a great price and decided to try them. I had the XM4’s for a short time but had to return them because they were too creaky while wearing them. Luckily I have not had that same issue so far with the XM5’s. My biggest priorities for headphones is comfort, sound quality (both for music and phone calls), and noise cancellation.

Comfort
The XM5’s have ear cups that are slightly larger than the XM4s and they also look slightly larger than the NC700s. This helps them go over the ears better. However, the NC700s have slightly thicker padding which makes the inside of the cup a little deeper. For this reason, I would say that the NC700s are a bit more comfortable for long periods. The XM5s are very comfortable, but after a couple of hours, I definitely start to feel them more than the NC700s. But both are great.

Sound Quality
This is a matter of preference, but I prefer the deeper bass and fuller sound of the XM5s. I would say the NC700s have a more balanced sound, with far less low end. The XM5s really give a nice full bass, without it being over-bearing. I do prefer a bit more lower end than what the Bose provides. So for me, I prefer the sound quality of the XM5s quite a bit more than the NC700s.

Call Quality
I use my headphones for work calls several hours a day. Both the XM5 and the NC700 have great call quality and will work really well if you use them for phone calls or Zoom meetings a lot. I think I’d give the edge to the XM5s because they block out ambient noise slightly better than the NC700s, but the difference is negligible.

Noise Cancellation
I mean, these are high end headphones and both do a great job with noise cancellation. I will say, I was surprised at how much noise the XM5s can block out. They block out voices and medium pitched noises better than the NC700s. They are both great with lower pitched things like plane noise. But I think the XM5s do a better job overall.

Build Quality and Design
This is where the Bose NC700s are just better than the XM5s. The build of the NC700s is just beautiful. They feel substantial without being too heavy, and there isn’t a seam anywhere. I also think they just look amazing. The XM5s do have seams around the ear cups and they feel much more plasticky. The XM5s are not bad, but they just are not as good as the NC700s as far as design and build quality.

Battery Life
The battery on the NC700 lasts me around 13 or 14 hours. The XM5s last around 25 hours. So it’s a pretty big difference. Charging speed seems about the same with both.

Odds and Ends
Features of each are similar. They both offer pass through audio and it works well on both. Touch controls work equally well on both. The case of the XM5s is a little bigger than the NC700s, if that matters to you. One small difference that may make a difference to some is that if you want to use the cord to plug them into a 3.5mm headphone jack, the end the plugs into the NC700s is 2.5mm. So if you lose the included cord, you will need a specific type of aux cord to replace it (2.5mm to 3.5mm). Whereas the XM5 uses a regular 3.5mm to 3.5mm aux cord.

Overall I do like these Sonys better. I just wish they had the comfort and build quality of the Bose. But because of the superior noise cancellation and sound quality, I’m going to be using the Sonys from now on.

data.title: Great all-around headphones
data.body:
These headphones to everything I want them to do. They sound great, have great battery life, and easy to use touch controls.

The noise cancellation could be slightly better, but nothing is perfect. Down the road, I also worry a bit about the matte rubberized coating coming off like it tends to do on plastic products over time, but for now, these are great.

The included case is a bonus. Makes them far less prone to damage when travelling.

data.title: Thanks to YouTuber Flossy Carter I was able to see …
data.body:
… that I should NOT listen to the negative reviews on such an amazing product. He does a full 1/2 hour review and comparison to other headsets. His rating is ANC is God Tier level which = Scary Good Tier or wearing these in inner city USA is “Git’n Robbed Tier” as they’d be snatched off yo head LOL.

The guy is hilarious, an excellent reviewer, insightful, super communicative, and thorough.

These will amaze you.

data.title: Great Sound, Crap Build Quality
data.body:
Theses honestly feel like a $150 headphone that's been taking advantage of the corporate price gouging and price hikes that we keep seeing.

They sound GREAT. So, if headphone sound is all you care about, these are great. I would argue you can probably find a set that sound just as a good for half the money.

They feel good: I demo'd Airpod Maxes and Bose QC Ultras, and both got really uncomfortable after a couple hours of continuous use. These are light and the cups are huge, so they don't feel like they're digging into my ears after a while.

Noise cancelling/Software: 3 out of 5 stars. ANC is mediocre; nothing special. Software for controller EQ is also so-so. Don't buy these if you're hoping to block out crazy people on the metro.

Build quality: trash. These cups honestly feel like they're connected with the same cheapo metal band Sony used to build their original headphones with in 1989. They're flimsy and I feel like if I tried not-very-hard, I could easily twist the ear cup 360 degrees off of the connecting bar. This isnt a huge deal other than the fact that they're $300+... they should feel commensurate of a $300 set of headphones. I get these aren't studio grade, but still.

The only other gripe I have with these is the soft controls are really easy to trigger just by touching the ear cup. I ended up turning them off.

data.title: Great headphones
data.body: They block out quite a bit of noise and the sound is excellent. Very comfortable over the ears. As past reviews have said they wish they could have been a little more easier to store in a better case. The case is designed wrong.

data.title: good
data.body: great headphones- did not come with charging cord as advertised

data.title: Excellent noise reduction.
data.body: I bought a pair of noise reduction headphones years ago to reduce noise while I worked in a noisy environment. These headphones are much much better. When the noise reduction is active I hear almost nothing. I only hear the audio that is streaming via Bluetooth. The audio is clear with good bass.

data.title: Beware Skin Irritation from ear cups
data.body: Everything about these headphones was excellent - outstanding sound, noise cancellation and battery life. However, after using them on an overseas flight, I developed a skin irritation that was initially mild. On my return trip, the irritation was extreme. Since then, I have not been able to use the headphones. I have not had this issue with other headsets in similar situations.

data.title: Simply amazing, and if you have the budget worth every penny
data.body:
I have been using Sony noise canceling earbuds for the last couple of years. I own both the XM3 and XM4 models and I have come to really love both the sound quality and the extra features Sony has packed them. Fast bear on android is amazing, it works without any effort. The first time you turn it on or if you turn it on in pairing mode a picture of the headphones will pop up on a nearby android device and you just click connect, it is as simple as connecting air pods to an iPhone.

Onto these headphones, they are exceptional. Battery life is amazing, but that is to be expected from any premium wireless over your headphones.
The touch controls have a bit of a learning curve, but they are for the most part very good (I have one issue with them, but I will get to that later).
The noise cancelling is amazing of course, but what is more impressive is the improvements made to transparency mode. It no longer picks up background noise from fans and cars as much as it used to. Support for Spotify tap means you can launch Spotify, and have it pick up where you left off without even touching your phone.
The new safe listening feature tells you if you are listening to music at unsafe levels for too long. It keeps track of how much time you listen at various decibel levels so it can tell you if you have been listening too much.
Sound quality is of course very good. Also, Sony's EQ is not the best, but for most people it is more than sufficient. If you like a bit more or less base you can adjust all of that very easily, and it comes with several presets.

The issues:

I have had three issues with my headphones so far. The first one was a strange bug where it identified to my phone as the FCC registered model number instead of as WH 1000 XM5 with a reset after a firmware update.
The next issue is that I have not been able to get it to register with Google's find my device service, it is not a huge deal for me especially because I am less likely to leave the headphones somewhere that I am something smaller like earbuds, but it seems like that can be a bit hit or miss.
The last issue is one that I alluded to earlier, and it is with the touch controls. These headphones do not have a physical Google assistant or any digital assistant button, instead you either say the wake word, or press and hold on the radio until you hear a tone. There is a strange bug when I tried to reply to a text that the Google assistant just read to me. It records my reply, but then says to push the Google assistant button to send or press and hold to record the message. You cannot push the Google assistant button, or you can do is press and hold which will just record the message so you cannot send your reply. However, this does not seem to be an issue when you just try to send a text, only when you reply so it is not the end of the world.

Well, that ended up being longer than I thought it would. I hope someone has found this helpful because I just spent far too long writing it.

data.title: Could of been great!
data.body:
The ear cups are too shallow and ears get really hot and sweaty. This would have been a 10/10 product if only the earcups had a little more space between them and the ear. Unfortunately they don’t. Had to return them. Shame really, because sound and noise cancellation is amazing.
Oh and 1 more bad thing, audio 360 is a complete mess because they don’t implement it to anything unless you pay for it. You have to pay for the service which is absolutely ridiculous.

data.title: Great but expensive
data.body: Great headphones but a but pricey. Also wish I could tap to change songs or control volume.

data.title: Like listening to old songs for first time.
data.body:
Hearing parts of songs that I listened to hundreds of times that I never heard before. Just small little details I've never heard, honestly It feels like I'm listening to music for the first time.

Noise cancellation is amazing.

Now the bad: The app is pretty plain and cumbersome, it's functional so not much to complain about but It clearly is an afterthought.

Now the construction of it I have a few problems with. Considering the price you would think it would be mostly metal but in fact there really no metal on it at all. It feels pretty cheap. Now don't get me wrong The plastic is not creakily and crappy. I don't feel like it's going to break easily It just looks like it... The headband is even made of plastic which I thought was weird. I figured it would be like metal or something but I guess not. Otherwise it's very comfortable. Buttons feel pretty cheap though too The ones that aren't touch anyway.

Overall I think for the price it could be mostly metal. But it does give the impression it's mostly durable at least there's no obvious looking weak points besides maybe the buttons being super crappy.

data.title: Great Condition and Quality
data.body:
I've been researching these headphones along with other brands and models, and I decided on the Sony XM5's. But the thing is, I didn't want to spend $300+ on a pair of headphones. I was looking for the used headphones and I was able to save about $100 from its sale price. I was expecting maybe just the headphones and nothing else, but when it arrived it came with everything! It didn't come in its original packaging but the case, wires, and headphones were all included.

The condition I bought it as said "Used", but these headphones were practically brand new. As soon as I powered them on, it prompted a connection to my OnePlus phone immediately. The sound is beautiful and the bass is incredible. There is practically 0 latency and no compromise to sound. There were no scratches or damage to the headphones and I couldn't have been happier with this purchase. If you are able to find a deal as good as mine, I would highly recommend you take it. If you aren't happy with your purchase, you are always able to return them. These headphones will definitely last me years of use.

data.title: Obsessed
data.body: Absolutely in love with these headphones. Got them specifically for when I want to wear headphones for a long period of time because wearing AirPods for more than two hours is wildly uncomfortable. These are light, comfortable, don't put too much pressure on your head, and aren't super hot. They look great, the sound quality and noise cancellation is excellent, and the battery life is INSANE. Love the touch controls on the right side--makes it super easy to control your music quickly. Don't regret a single penny I spent on these.

data.title: Major improvements!
data.body: I had an older noise cancelling device and this one is heads and tails better. I’m super pleased with that end of it and the music quality is excellent for a non audio file like me

data.title: Practically exactly what I wanted
data.body: The noise cancelation is really good. Like really good. But there are a couple complaints. They won't always block the same amount of noise, so if you live in a semi noisy environment, that really changes the way you look at these headphones. You can hear when the quality of this feature specifically, drops or rises. A really simple fix though, just turn the volume up a little more. Then it really is just you and the music. The transparency mode I felt just slightly let down. It can be better. Speak to chat is much more powerful which upsets me because it's like you don't even have headphones on. You end up wanting that kind of immersion on demand when it's only attainable through the speak/hold to chat features. Of course when those are enabled, the volume of your music gets reduced HEAVILY, so you can hear what's going on. If you're just turning on ambient noise, you might find it muddy or just not as clear as you'd expect or want. An amazing feature with ambient noise though, is you can control how much noise comes through. This helps me a lot because if you are feeling overwhelmed by your environment, you can just turn it down or shut it off completely. I guess you can say you have a lot of choices between complete isolation, and near perfect immersion. The pros, in my opinion, really overpower the cons. The sound quality is amazing. You can expect crisp, clear, quality audio with insane customization. The separation and sound staging are quite precise I'd say, and with the app you can have practically unlimited bass while still maintaining crisp, prominent highs, that do not interrupt or drown out the mids. Of course the amount of depth these headphones have can only make you dream of what more they may be capable of. I absolutely love the equalizer because now you have such a range with your listening experience, you can resonate with music on so many different levels using the equalizer. These headphones are built for every genre of music BECAUSE they're so precise and customizable as far as sound goes. That's a massive plus, interpreting a song differently because you changed the way it sounded. The smaller drivers do not in any way take from the sound quality. They sound like quality headphones, and the volume control is consistent. The sound quality does not change until about maybe 90-100%. They fit nice, but I wish the design were more like travel headphones where you fold the cups into themselves. They feel very durable, especially the headband. The touch sensors are nice too, but I wish you could use both cups instead of one, so you can customize what taps do what. Overall, they were worth the money. They're for everyone, however you listen, and whatever you listen to. Your preference in sound can be a lot more precise using these headphones. I mean, they really make it hard to say another pair is better. I have grown a lot with these headphones, musically speaking. There are no boundaries in the world of music, and there certainly are not limitations to reach that boundless world inside these headphones.

data.title: good quality
data.body: It is perfect and I use it whole day, everyday……

data.title: This is next level...
data.body: This is the 3rd pair of expensive over-the-ear headphones I ever owned and you can just feel the generational difference between those. This is next level in every possible sense. Pairs seamlessly, plays well, and blocks out noise fantastically! Also, dark blue looks phenomenal in daylight!

data.title: Excellent
data.body: I had the airpods max before these and they broke 1 year and 8 months in. Compared to the airpods these are insanely comfy and the quality is most likely the same if not better, plus having an off button is the best thing that's ever happened to me. These are perfect and worth the price!

data.title: Sound quality and noise cancellation is great!!
data.body: The portability, the ear muffs don't fold like the previous model. The head band is not comfortable on bald heads.

data.title: Amazing sound
data.body: These headphones are beautiful and the sound quality is amazing. After I received these headphones, I switched from Spotify to Amazon Music Unlimited, with ultra HD quality, and it's like I am hearing all my favorite music for the first time. The noise cancelling is mind-blowing. Definitely exceeded my expectations.

data.title: Loving for 13mos Now.....But a Little Problem..!!
data.body:
Having been in search for a way to block out screaming babies on my flights...omg....like for 15 hours. These have saved and changed my life. Loved these from my upgrade from the XM4 and before that Bose QC30...and I have to say these are amazing for their comfort, up to 95% give or take ANR, and Sound Quality, and INCREDIBLE BATTERY LIFE that just makes it My Favorite Ever ANR Headset. This, after all these years of the Battle of Noise Cancelling Headsets. The pretend ANR, is not in Full Focus with this Full Headphone, as the ANC Wars between Sony and Bose still move forward. Don't get me wrong, not bashing Bose, as their New EarPods Ultra, are VERY IMPRESSIVE<, but on a Jet/Airplane flight, those are gone to the great beyond after a hap chance ear dislodgment. Bye Bye.

Anyway, loving to Love these Awesome WM5, but now, a whittle problem...;/ As I have read on Reddit and elsewhere. Seems, the onboard batteries, or whatever emit a foul odor, similar reeks of despair, similar to battery burnoff, have had from battery backups boxes. This after being properly stored in a cool dry area, and two months ago, was on a flight. But just noticed after using them for a online jam, picked up and quite the reeks-ville, strong sulphur odor out of case. This is Quite alarming, so, anyone noting similar, please lets hear as this is sad, as they are not cheap, and really is a foul odor of hydrogen sulphide is NOT a Good Sign. Just a Heads up for Y'all....!!

data.title: Best headphones!
data.body: Love these headphones! Noise canceling. Knows to turn down music if someone is talking to me. Comfortable and easy to use. Fast charging.

data.title: They do sound great, comfort leaves a bit to be desired.
data.body: They sound good, the ANC works well, and the multi-connection features work great when I'm swapping between my phone and laptop. Comfort is a bit lacking though. The ear cups feel oversized relative to the headband. They're light, but they also feel a little cheaply made because of all the plastic. The headband isn't very comfortable for me on long sessions like some others are.

data.title: Great Quality headphones
data.body: These headphones are fabulous to use for studying. It's what I use them for. I like that after wearing them for over an hour, my ears don't hurt. It's a great purchase to make when they are on sale.

data.title: Works well
data.body: I really like these. Not sure they are worth the cost and are more inconvenient than my AirPods to travel with but overall really great sound quality and noise cancellation

data.title: Pretty good. Mic doesn't connect to laptop
data.body: Good headphones, great noise cancelling, love the touch functions instead of buttons. Great phone connectivity. Has issues connecting fully to Windows computer so I can't use the mic for teams/zoom calls. I've tried all the things support and forums recommend.

data.title: As good as they say they are!
data.body: They are very comfortable. The noise canceling is incredible. They sound great and the battery life is very good!

data.title: It’s not 100% Noise Cancellation
data.body: If you want 100% Noise Cancellation, use ear plugs that are made for it not a pair of Bluetooth Headphones. Does it work great if you’re playing music or something, yeah. Having Noise Cancellation with music playing does help focus more on the songs. I wouldn’t rate the “Surround Sound”/360 audio as mind blowing, but it does the job. That being said, it’s amazing how clear some sounds can be, such as in Call of Duty… or Minecraft. Zero disappointment if you want clear audio since the ear cushion works wonders (Not sure how long they will last though). As for charging and using the audio Jack at the same time since Bluetooth doesn’t work while it’s charging, I found it a horrible experience. Just get a good charging brick, a decent length usb-c cable and charge the thing once it reaches 20%. Go eat, take a walk or do it in your sleep but that battery wasn’t lying about being able to reach 30 hours. Though I would only limit it to 20-24 hours before checking the battery limit by pressing the power button again and hearing it tell you the power level. I don’t plan on killing the battery health and you should too for this price point. As for the range, Bluetooth 5 is impeccable especially with a quality device and limited walls between you, your pc and the kitchen. As for volume control, it changes it by small increment, though holding on to the right pad with your palm does activate transparency mode and lower the volume so you can hear someone talk. Downloading the app will show you a few things btw. It’s just a little overpriced by maybe $80 bucks, but you can’t deny the microphone quality. It’s quite good on mobile but if you use OBS to record there is always that noise. That being said, it does isolate my voice quite well in a loud environment and the Noise Cancellation keeps me from hearing anyone talk though to how high I have the volume playing my content to immerse myself. But like I said, without any content playing you can still hear stuff through the noise cancellation but once you play something else on top it’s gold. If there was once feature they should’ve added it would be dual control on both ear cuffs instead of just the right. I’m not left handed but it would increase usability since I don’t always get the action I want done though to me lying down or whatnot and my hand gesture was a little off from the four main directions. Also can we get a PC App or settings? I hate having to use my phone to change a few things such as the level of noise cancellation or shutting off/on the gesture control. There are times when I forget to turn them back on and when I switch to PC/Mac I have to go back to my phone to turn those controls back on. If there is a desktop App, me not so bright. That being said, it’s a good product, just a tad overpriced. Let’s see how long I can keep it alive.

data.title: Love my headphones but
data.body: 6 months now with my Sony WH-1000XM5 headphones absolutely love them, the sound is like anything else I've ever experienced. However there's a few (cons) I've encountered with my headphones. To start.. After a few weeks that i received my XM5 I started using them for pretty much everything even to help me sleep. I was truly impressed with the noise canceling so when I struggled to fall asleep because of the noise that 4 young siblings would make at 11pm I figured I take advantage of my XM5s noise canceling. However when all was quite I noticed a very mild muffled pitch sound that would come on and off almost unnoticeable but for someone that can only sleep with zero to no sound any sounds are noticeable. The sound seemed to get a bit more noticeable to my ears enough to render me from using them to sleep or noise canceling and using other alternatives instead. Second con is that the headphones do not pause or turn off automatically when removed from head. I had the XM4 prior to the XM5 and when I would take them off they would pause and turn off automatically when not in use no problem. My XM5 however stay connected to my phone all day and night unless I turn them off manually. Resulting in a dead battery more often then my XM4s . I thought I could get over these problems but for the price I paid I expected my headphones to function with the quality that Sony is known for. Makes me question if upgrading from my XM4 was a mistake.

data.title: Great
data.body: They work well

data.title: My favorite headphones
data.body: These are the most comfortable and sound great. Battery lasts long enough as well.

data.title: Noise Cancelling is amazing!
data.body: I have been looking for perfect noise-canceling headphones since I don't like to listen to loud music, and these are IT! They completely block out any outside noise right away. Someone could be next to me speaking while I have these on and not hear a word. The only downside to these for me is that the first time I put them on they were VERY tight and uncomfortable almost right away. I nearly returned them for this reason because my purpose for getting them was to sit and read in peace but couldn't do that if I was uncomfortable. However, I had the idea to stretch them out a bit so I placed them over my thigh for about 30 min and they were perfect after that. I have yet to have a headache from them since! Hope this helps ^.^

data.title: Almost perfect
data.body:
Sound quality and ANC are phenomenal compare to the airpod pro max (I do own 2 of them). I had my AC on in my room, it's pretty loud, even I can still hear a little bit of noise after putting on airpod pro max. However, when I use the XM5, the noise is completely gone, it feels like the AC is far away.
Unfortunately, I had to return it because I tend to sweat a lot when gaming or working out. So if you're someone who live in a warm temperature room or go to the gym a lot, this will not hold up. I really hope Sony will make the next Gen XM6 with IP65 or higher because the leather on XM5 holds a lot of sweat. Another reason I had to return it was because the headband isn't quite comfortable. Even though a lot of tech youtubers say the cushion is thick on the headband despite its slim size, I still hope they would stick with XM4 headband cushion design. My head got really hurt after an hour of using it, feels like there's a dent on my head every time I after I use it. I've also read a lot of comments on forums like reddit, sony, and reviews saying the headband and design is very narrow making the top of the head hold the most weight. In addition, because of narrow design I can never find the good balance. If I set the headphone too tight, top of my head gona hurt, but if I set it too loose it does solve the hurting head issue but it will fall off.
Another con for this headphone is the ear cups, I wish they would've rotated inside instead of outward when you rest it on the shoulder. Overall, I love the sound quality, ANC, and the smooth swipe controls. I hope for the next gen, XM6 they will add more padding, stronger point on rotate area, and please for the sake of God please do water resistant IP65 or higher. It's 2023, technology is so advanced now, I know they can do amazing things not just some cheap recycled plastic.

data.title: Great but a bit confusing
data.body: Battery Life is really good in my option, I only use my headphone when I go to class and back though, or if I’m going around the city. I do think the case takes up a lot of space though. I did have some issues when I called with my headphones, it kept echoing to both sides, so that was the worst thing, I’d rather not use my airpods to call when I have headphones. I love the color of it and personally just like it overall. It’s best to watch a video on the different features it has. Noise cancellation is great as well, I don’t usually turn my volume very high though.

data.title: Sounds
data.body:
Love this blue tooth headset, sound comes though Chrystal clear makes my work fun.
A must have, SONY the only way to go.
Came in a relatively fast manner, came as described. Great headphones, i bought these for my girlfriend because i love the pair i have so much.

data.title: Amazing sound, touch controls need work
data.body:
I haven’t owned any headsets so my review is coming from a complete sound novice.
First off They look very cool and sleek, I do have a little head so they are a little big when on but that’s a personal thing, they are comfy and lightweight.
The presentation is nice, the travel case is well built and the magnetic cable compartment Is a great idea and keeps up with the sleek design.
There are a lot of features you can access using the Sony App which is unique, especially the option to personalise the sound to your liking.
The touch controls need help, you don’t know where you’re tapping and it can be a little frustrating, but covering the right side with your hand to use the transparency feature is very handy.
Noise cancelling is okay to good, I can still hear higher pitched sounds but does great for reducing ambient sounds.
Overall I think they are amazing, maybe a little over priced but this is the world we live in now.
I will say, vocals touched my soul when I first was listening with these, the richness is incredible and I’m listening to my old songs like it’s the first time.

data.title: Excellent! As advertised!
data.body: Item was very sustainably packaged, blue color is beautiful; operates perfectly and doesn’t make my ears hurt. I mostly use them to listen to music and the occasional phone call. They arrived charged about three weeks ago and I haven’t had to charge them at all! Very impressed with the battery life. The choice to hear ambient noise is helpful when I want loud music but also value my safety. Highly recommend! :)

data.title: Good but you need multiple apps for different features
data.body:
These were really good headphones and they were light weight. However, I am an iPhone user and I don’t know if it’s different for androids but you have to download multiple apps on your phone for some of the features they advertise. One example is the special awareness. They show this feature in the ad for the headphones but you have to download additional apps and make accounts. These apps then sent me a tone of marketing emails and it was a real hassle.
Above all that I couldn’t do many functions on my phone like having it, read my messages, talking to Siri, using voice control to make phone calls or for anything really. Again this may just be how they work with an iPhone but it was not the most user friendly if you were only using it to listen to media from your phone.

data.title: Amazing Headphones
data.body:
I really want to give these a 5 because I love them. I wear them all day for work (8+ hours at a time)and have to charge them maybe once a week. I really like that you can customize your listening experience but I don’t use it much. The noise cancelling is great, I travel a lot for work and I won’t use another pair of headphones when flying.

The only reason I gave them 4 stars (I wish I could do 4.75 or something) I because they’re the slightest bit too big for my head. I’ve been told I have a pretty small head so I’m not super surprised but they sit a little lower on my head/ears than I would prefer. That being said they’re super comfortable and don’t bother me. If I’m having a day where I want them to sit higher on my ears I just wear a hat and that fixes it for me.

They’re expensive headphones, but for the amount that I use them they’re worth every penny.

data.title: They are not as comfortable as I had hoped. My ears get hot and hurt.
data.body: The ear pads are small for me. I am average size. They are not as comfortable as I was hoping, my main reason for buying. My second reason is that corded earphones wire is a pain in the butt to manage. My ears get hot and hurt a little. My frame of reference is a wired set of high end sennheiser headphones. I also have a battery powered mid range panosonic headphone that also is uncomfortable.

data.title: Disappointed
data.body: Great sons and solid Bluetooth connections. Very uncomfortable. Ear padding is so thin that after a while of wearing the plastic housing ends up against your ear.

data.title: Best splurge in a long time!
data.body:
The headphones are fabulous and exactly what I've needed for a long time! They are great to use has a headset / mic for work, listening to music / podcasts while tuning out the world around me. They came in very handy for long car trips to tune out what the driver was listening too and also great for flying!
The only con is the L / R symbols blend into the navy color so you can't actually see which side is Left or Right. I just do it by touch of where the power button is.

data.title: Pretty good
data.body: Comfort is pretty good when on your head. For some reason, sony made the choice to not make these portable. They also dont sit flat when resting on your shoulders... The case is huge cuz they dont fold down so something to keep in mind for those who travel alot. Complaints outta way, music sounds good (id mess with the eq settings), battery life is ace. The quick charge is top tier, and this has multi device support. I wish this folded more, i also wish the ear cups just had a bit more cushion on the ears and some sorta sweat resistance. Overall I can easily recommend these.

data.title: Awesome sound, comfort and touch controls.
data.body:
Very comfortable. Excellent sound. Like the overall look and feel.
I live near an airport and even with noise cancelling I can hear planes taking off- a surprise but no complaints.
I would purchase them again. Also scheduled for delivery 22 Dec and arrived 12 Dec. Wow!
Bob Berrio

data.title: The best all-around wireless headphones
data.body:
I’m something of an audiophile, so it took me awhile to decide on which headphones I wanted to add to my collection. Forget Beats, and forget the AirPods Max. These Sony cans have stellar sound across the spectrum. You can EQ them to your liking. They’re comfortable. They’re well-made. The audio noise cancelling is the best I’ve ever heard in a sub-$500 pair of cans.

And when used for talking on the phone (or anything else requiring audio input), vocals are clear and pristine.

I can’t recommend these highly enough.

data.title: Just okay
data.body:
I bought these headphones to replace the apple airpods max, which had a broken volume knob. I ended up repairing the apple headphones and returning the XM5s. As an iphone/windows PC user, here is my perspective:

Pros:
1. The noise cancellation is about as good as the APM
2. The case is better than the APM
3. The headphones are lighter than APM (doesn't matter to me, may for some people)
4. The microphone works with windows PCs (unlike APM)

Negatives:
1. The integration with iOS is terrible. I have to power on the headphones and manually pair them every time I want to connect them to my phone. The Sony app is clunky. I just hate it compared to putting on my headphones and everything working with no manual intervention.
2. Sound quality is FAR inferior to APM. It's not bad, but it is clearly worse
3. The headphones are uncomfortable after >20min of use
4. The construction is plastic, while the APM are a metal-mesh combo
5. Volume control, ANC, and other controls are awkward to use with the touch panel. I prefer physical buttons. ANC is a physical button, but it's placed in an awkward position. It takes too much time to pause + disable ANC compared to the APM.

If you have an android, you may prefer the XM5 due to its lower cost. It may integrate better with android as well (I can't comment). Certainly if you have frequent work meetings the windows integration is better with the XM5s. That is the one distinct positive it has over the Apple headphones.

If you have a iPhone, and/or you don't plan to use the microphone on these headphones with a windows PC, the Airpods Max are a superior product.

data.title: Great for Gaming
data.body: Bought this as a replacement for my Razer Barracuda X (2022) wireless. The surround sound makes it great for gaming. The noise cancellation is really helpful as it blocks out all of my pc fan noise. I have an RTX 4090 so my fans tend to get really loud. The weight of these is the exact same as my old headset so I had no problem adjusting. Really comfortable headstrap and the ear parts secure on really good and are also very comfortable.

data.title: Unbelievable sound quality, call quality, and noise cancelation
data.body: The call quality is stupid awesome, the other end of the line can't hear anything but my voice. My favorite music and movies have never been more enjoyed, plain and simple. You hear parts of your favorite songs and background noises in movies that you didn't know existed. I'd pay a $1000 if I had to.
